intro: Draba verna var. majuscula, commonly known as the greater spring whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clustered inflorescences during early spring. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along stream banks.
